verses.roman:
dekhi' bhaṭṭācāryera mane haya mahā-bhaya
prabhura pratāpe tārā eka pāśa haya

synonyms: dekhi'—seeing; bhaṭṭācāryera—of Bhaṭṭācārya; mane—in the mind; haya—there was; mahā-bhaya—great fear; prabhura pratāpe—by the influence of Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; tārā—they; eka pāśa haya—stand to one side.
translation: Balabhadra Bhaṭṭācārya was very much afraid to see them, but by Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu's influence, all the animals stood to one side.
